meanings.definition: An official inspection of an individual's or organization's accounts or financial situation.
meanings.sent1: During the audit, the accountant carefully checked all the financial records.
meanings.sent2: The company hired an external auditor to perform an audit of their financial statements.
meanings.sent3: The audit revealed some discrepancies in the company's financial records, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The audit shone a light on the company's financial health, exposing areas that needed improvement.
meanings.sent5: The audit process was thorough and detailed, leaving no stone unturned in the financial examination.

meanings.definition: A systematic review or assessment of something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher conducted an audit of the students' performance to identify areas for improvement.
meanings.sent2: The annual audit of the company's operations helped streamline processes and increase efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The audit of the project's progress showed that they were ahead of schedule, much to everyone's delight.
meanings.sent4: The audit of the inventory revealed some discrepancies that needed to be addressed immediately.
meanings.sent5: The audit of the safety procedures highlighted areas where additional training was necessary.

meanings.definition: To conduct an official financial examination of an individual or organization.
meanings.sent1: The accountant will audit the company's financial records next week.
meanings.sent2: It is important to audit regularly to ensure financial transparency and accuracy.
meanings.sent3: She audited her own expenses to track where her money was going.
meanings.sent4: The government agency audited the organization to ensure compliance with financial regulations.
meanings.sent5: The auditor audited the accounts meticulously, leaving no room for error.
